title: BCC - Not hiding other emails....
content: In the works of Ai agents that are apparently automating everything (which I absolutely dispise) why is Thunderbird forcing me to send one email at a time so as to not show other recipients who I am also emailing.. I do not have the time for this. I also don't want to invest time into a mail merge set up like Chimp or Octopus. I just want to email 30+ people without the others seeing each other. But when I have tested with thunderbird with one customer email and my own as BCC - when I get the email in my inbox it literaly says - FROM: MY BUSINESS. - TO: MY CUSTOMER.. (yes my customers email address - not mine).. What is going on here?? I can not spend 45 minutes sending the same email... using copy and paste etc..

title: Nuovo messaggio diverso per due account nello stesso computer
content:
Ho dovuto "recuperare" l'archivio di Thunderbird perchè si era rovinato, forse per problemi nel disco.

Da quella volta le impostazioni dell'account "marioziliotto@tiscali.it" ed anche degli altri sono perfette mentre l'account "marioziliotto@gmail.it" risulta menomato, pur continuando a funzionare con limitazioni. Allego due immagini da cui si vede che in @gmail mancano tutte le opzioni grafiche.

Per di più quando scrivo una mail in @gmail lo spazio orizzontale è limitato e va a capo dopo un certo numero di caratteri mentre per gli altri account è tutto perfetto.

Si può sistemare @gmail senza dover riinstallare tutto?

Grazie
creator: marioziliotto

title: Lost all my calendar dates
content: Hi - I was presented with an update for Thunderbird, without an option to not update. So I updated. But now I've lost all the appointments and recurring dates on my original calendar. I can't find any sort of backup. Nor any synchronisation. This is going to cause me a ton of trouble and extra work. Can this be rectified? I have a basic knowledge of email so any technical stuff will need to be done by you. I really hope you can help. oh and please don't redirect me to some webpage which offers generic help. I need some hands on help please Kind regards Paul
creator: ucanpaint1

title: gestione email
content:
Il 15 agosto ho scritto (in inglese perché avevo letto che in tal modo avrei facilitato la risposta):

"Good afternoon,

when I close a message (email) on Thunderbird the program automatically opens the message which follows the closed message in the list of messages.

The result is a row of opened messages that clogs the page.

I would like tha only messages of my interest that I voluntarily open remain opened, not others.

Is it possible?

Thank you,

Gianluigi"

Il giorno successivo Next mi ha risposto inviandomi il seguente link, senza altre spiegazioni:

-> https://support.mozilla.org/it/questions/1529497#answer-1757095

Visto che questo link non si apriva cliccandoci sopra e neppure facendo copia/incolla nella barra di Google Chrome ho risposto a Next facendo gentilmente presente che non mi era possibile accedere ai contenuti di questo link e che quindi mi serviva un link che potessi aprire oppure un invio diretto di quanto avrei letto se il link si fosse aperto.

Lo stesso giorno Next mi ha risposto:

"Ma mi stai prendendo in giro?" ed ha chiuso il caso.

L'ultima risposta di Next è l'unica che ho compreso in quanto è stata espressa con delle parole (non solo link come le precedenti) però mi ha sbigottito.

Se ricevo un link che non si apre e (con la massima gentilezza) lo faccio presente sto forse prendendo in giro qualcuno? Che cosa avrei dovuto fare per non urtare la suscettibilità di Next? Mettere un like e chiudere il caso senza averci capito nulla?

E' la prima volta che chiedo supporto per Thunderbird ma l'esperienza non è stata certo quella che mi attendevo.

Non credo che il mio quesito fosse particolarmente complesso e se qualcuno vorrà aiutarmi a risolvere questo piccolo problema di gestione pratica della posta elettronica gliene sarò grato.

Saluti a tutti

Gianluigi Rossi - --INDIRIZZO RIMOSSO--

E' la prima volta che chiedo assistenza per Thunderbird
creator: gianluigi.rossi

title: Calendar disabled after recent update
content: I have been very happy using Thunderbird to access the email account of my volunteer position, I have always used the Email, Calendar and Task feature. I have the automatic updates setup on Thunderbird and until recently had no issues at all, until the last update. When Thunderbird first started with the newest update the calendar details were visible and then Thunderbird disabled the Calendar and Task and no matter how many time I click the Enable button or edit the properties to say enable Thunderbird immeadiately sets it back to Disabled. I have uninstalled Thunderbird, and relinstalled an older version - problem there doesn't seem to be a profile to match, so I just kept manually updating Thunderbird to a newer update until the absolute latest, but there were issues with the profiles again. I then uninstalled and installed the latest version available directly from the website and was able to get another profile to work for my local folders - I had saved some docs locally to conserve disk space on the email server. But no matter what I cannot get the calendar to work at all. There are no posts that cover this particular situation. Any idea how to fix this???? Thank you to anyone that offers assistance with this issue.
creator: saltandpepperrogers

title: Tbird will NOT save drafts of in-composition emails
content:
Great, so I fix one problem, only to be confronted with a shiny brand NEW problem.

Version 141.0

Fixed the "T-bird lockup" when composing emails, so that's no longer an issue - - YAY.

Now, Tbird refuses to save drafts. I had it set to every minute while I was having issues with lockups; now, I'm seeing a "can't save draft' popup every minute. I mean really... I haven't changed ONE thing in the machine other than changing that "0" to a "1" in "about:settings." Is there something about that particular fix that could cause this "save no drafts" issue?

Don't have a clue where to even begin, since it cites either network issues OR file-access issues, and I fail to see why either would suddenly be an issue where it wasn't prior to fixing the lockups.

Anyone have any pointers where to start looking? I keep seeing reference to Tbird "logs," but have no idea where to find those. Seems a reasonable place to start (after all, it's the first thing I look at when my 3D printer goes nuts!)
creator: kharrisma

title: apertura automatica delle email
content:
Buonasera,

ogni volta che sposto nel cestino una mail da una cartella di "posta inviata" o "posta in arrivo" il programma Thunderbird apre automaticamente la mail immediatamente successiva a quella eliminata.

Questa procedura automatica comporta il fatto che in caso di eliminazioni multiple la pagina risulta intasata da una serie di mail aperte senza alcuna necessità.

Chiedo quindi se è possibile eliminare questo automatismo.

Grazie per l'attenzione

Gianluigi Rossi Loc. Valdana 9 - Porto Azzurro- LI
creator: gianluigi.rossi

title: Install Thunderbird on external USB drive, and import mboxes to the same drive?
content:
How can I install Thunderbird on an external USB drive for my Mac, and, import an mbox to it (or a bunch of mboxes?) that also lives on that external drive? And keep this email account data disconnected from the original account it came from, that is, do NOT have it sync with Gmail? Perhaps it's best if I describe my situation and the result I'm trying to achieve.... (sorry for the length of this question; I'm trying to be precise and comprehensive at the same time 😬)

Situation: 1. Used macOS Mail for years, to manage a Gmail account 2. Recently used takeout.google.com to download the mbox for this account, which turned out to be 91.01GB (!) 3. I tried using macOS Mail on another computer to open it, and it's not happening; file seems too large; I get an error message saying the Mac's memory has been used up and Mail has stopped working 4. I'm currently waiting for a subsequent Google Takeout download that I expect will consist of many, many mbox files (each mbox corresponding to its own label, according to How to Download/Export Emails with Google Takeout) 5. I have limited space on my computer and would like to avoid accommodating 91.01+GB of historical email data

Desired result: 1. I'm basically trying to create a back-up of all my Gmail emails so that... 2. I can delete a bunch of them, reorganize them, etc. using my macOS Mail program, while being confident that... 3. I can always return to the easily accessible and searchable emails in Thunderbird

Add'l Thoughts/Specific questions: 1. Can I install and run the macOS version of Thunderbird on an external USB thumbdrive by simply dragging the TB app icon to the external drive to start the installation process? 2. Assuming TB has successfully been installed on the external drive, how do I make sure TB knows that the data from the mbox(es) I import should "live" on the external drive as well?

Thank you so much for reading and in advance for your advice.
creator: burntproductions
